p: Our results show that the Scandinavian arctic fox population lost at least 50% of its mitochondrial haplotypes as a result of the demographic bottleneck that started at the turn of the twentieth century ( figure 4; electronic supplementary material figure S2). Moreover, compared to previous studies [ 20], the higher resolution of the mitogenomic sequences allowed for better estimations of both haplotype and nucleotide diversity, revealing previously unknown significant losses following the bottleneck ( figure 5). The coalescent simulations coupled with ABC analyses suggested an approximately 20-fold decline in N ef , which is roughly in line with expectations based on historical records [ 16, 17].
